item.title: Happy to be able to welcome the #openstreetmap foundation's newest corporate member! RT @TomTom@twitter.com: Read more about how we're supporting the OpenStreetMap Foundation below!

Join #openstreetmap Open Source Development for Google Summer of Code 2023! GSoC applications open on Monday, March 20. / @googleoss@twitter.com #opensource #osm https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/03/16/join-osm-open-source-development-with-gsoc-2023/

We're happy to be welcoming @TomTom as a Platinum corporate member of the OSMF. Thanks for giving such strong financial support for the stability and quality of #openstreetmap! https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/03/16/welcome-tomtom-our-first-platinum-corporate-member/

Ahead of tomorrow‚Äôs International Women‚Äôs Day, we put the spotlight on @geoladiesph. Happy #IWD2023 to them and all women in OSM! To join the celebration, check the post for a list of events around #InternationalWomensDay2023 #EmbraceEquity #OpenStreetMap https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/03/07/international-womens-day-meet-geoladies-ph/

Procrastinators take note! It's just one week to the March 13 deadline for submitting a proposal to the EWG for "Adding the Ability to Mute Users" https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/02/10/ewg-project-deadline-adding-the-ability-to-mute-users/

Craig Allen is getting traction on election promises by building diversity and inclusion, improving documentation, and building connections in Africa--read the rest of his statement here: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/01/27/2023-on-the-osmf-board-our-individual-views/ RT @openstreetmap@twitter.com Craig Allen (South Africa) https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/cRaIgalLAn üê¶üîó: https://twitter.com/openstreetmap/status/1616766701202284547

Arnalie Vicario's (@arnalielsewhere@twitter.com) statement was succinct: --Building more local chapters --Diversifying OSMF membership, including membership of OSMF Working Groups --Ensuring financial sustainability and effective fundraising https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/01/27/2023-on-the-osmf-board-our-individual-views/ RT @openstreetmap@twitter.com Here's the Twitter version: (in alphabetical order on the post and here) Arnalie Vicario (Philippines) @arnalielsewhere@twitter.com üê¶üîó: https://twitter.com/openstreetmap/status/1616766422524350465

Guillaume ( @grischard@twitter.com ) has a long list of priorities, including improving infrastructure reliability (w/ @firefishy1@twitter.com ) and process improvements--all the details are here: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/01/27/2023-on-the-osmf-board-our-individual-views/

Mateusz Konieczny wants to focus on the basics, including GDPR, attribution, software and budgeting--read his complete statement on the blog post: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/01/27/2023-on-the-osmf-board-our-individual-views/

Mikel Maron ( @mikel@twitter.com ) wants to focus on fundraising, as well as on OSMF communications--read his complete statement on the post: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/01/27/2023-on-the-osmf-board-our-individual-views/ RT @openstreetmap@twitter.com Mikel Maron (USA) @mikel@twitter.com üê¶üîó: https://twitter.com/openstreetmap/status/1616767484496936961

Roland Olbricht wants to focus on fundraising for improvement projects and new projects. Read his whole statement on the blog post: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/01/27/2023-on-the-osmf-board-our-individual-views/ RT @openstreetmap@twitter.com Roland Olbricht (Germany) https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/User:Roland.olbricht üê¶üîó: https://twitter.com/openstreetmap/status/1616767739888033793

Sarah Hoffman wants to improve OSMF operations and gather wisdom from the working groups--read her full statement at: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/01/27/2023-on-the-osmf-board-our-individual-views/ RT @openstreetmap@twitter.com Sarah Hoffmann (Germany) https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/User:Lonvia üê¶üîó: https://twitter.com/openstreetmap/status/1616767935623712780

Craig Allen is getting traction on election promises by building diversity and inclusion, improving documentation, and building connections in Africa--read the rest of his statement here: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/01/27/2023-on-the-osmf-board-our-individual-views/ RT @openstreetmap@twitter.com Craig Allen (South Africa) https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/cRaIgalLAn üê¶üîó: https://twitter.com/openstreetmap/status/1616766701202284547

a new blog post is up! "Starting 2023 on the OSMF Board" The OSMF board met and set an agenda for next year--here is a top level overview in their own words. https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/01/27/2023-on-the-osmf-board-our-individual-views/

https://twitter.com/OSM_Tech/status/1614785339729625090 RT @OSM_Tech@twitter.com Reminder of upcoming scheduled maintenance this Sunday January 22nd 2023 between 10:00 and 15:00 UTC/GMT. Full details: https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2022-December/087948.html ü™õüíæüíªüòÖ üê¶üîó: https://twitter.com/OSM_Tech/status/1614785339729625090

Read about these folks' many contributions to OSM communities and working groups, organizations like @GeochicasOSM@twitter.com @WomenInGeo@twitter.com, @StreetComplete@twitter.com, @hotosm@twitter.com & many other projects & find links to interviews at the link: #osmf #OpenStreetMap https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/01/19/get-to-know-the-new-osmf-board/
Sarah Hoffmann (Germany) https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/User:Lonvia
Roland Olbricht (Germany) https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/User:Roland.olbricht
